explanation: toxdigitvalue: need its prototype (parameter and return types). The target calls toxdigitvalue with pct_encoded[..]; to confirm that no pointer is passed and to verify whether any pointer-to-non-const is involved in that call (affects whether pct_encoded could or should be further qualified). MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_: the target delegates to this function when MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE is defined. Its prototype (const/ non-const qualifiers on pct_encoded and decoded parameters and whether it modifies decoded) is needed to determine whether the target’s parameter types (especially decoded) are correct or should be const-qualified. MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE: the macro controls which branch is compiled. Knowing its definition/value is required to know whether analysis must consider the inlined implementation (which writes into decoded) or the delegating call (whose signature must be examined). get_rq_extended_uname_copy_z: this caller supplies real arguments to MHD_str_pct_decode_strict_n_. Inspecting how it passes pct_encoded and decoded (whether it supplies const buffers or writable buffers) helps determine if there is any mismatch between caller and callee const-qualification that would indicate a MISRA violation in the target or its usages.
